author: A_Brickset_user
title: A nice set for a neglected Star Wars vehicle
review:
This, along with the B-wing, are the most under-rated ships of the Rebel fleet. If you have read some of the comments below, the A-Wing was important in the ROTJ, although it was only briefly shown.

A nice little set that comes with a pilot and a mechanic. The vehicle itself is solid and highly playable (the windshield and the hatch in the back open up). Although the overall look is a little on the bland side, this is made up with the high playablility and "swoosh" value of this set. Considering it has 123 pcs and was sold for only US$14.99 (although selling for a lot more now), this set was a great value and should be in everyone's collection!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Highly satisfying set
review:
A cool set, nice a solid. The colors are good and details are fine. Comes with an A-Wing pilot and a mechanic minifig. A good representation of the A-Wing considering it's one of the early releases. Now all I need is the Y-Wing to complete my rebel fleet!!

I agree with mofiman, considering the price, this is a good value and it's a fun little set.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Kewl
review:
I only really got into Star Wars Lego once I saw the Star Destroyer.  I already had the TIE/Y-Wing and X-Wing from a few years ago, but that was it.

This little set, along with the Shuttle were the two "must haves" among the out-of-production sets so I was really happy when I finally managed to get my hands on one.

It's not an incredibly detailed model and the nose structure isn't quite there, but it is damn cool.  The construction is sturdy (probably one of the most sturdy of the minifig scale models) and it looks like what it's supposed to.  I wasn't fussed about the mechanic, but the A-wing pilot is a great figure to have.

I love the set, but I can't possibly give it more than a 7 due to the relative nature of the marks.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: cockpit
review:
Cool set, but the nose at front is a little ugl and I still haven't warmed to the particular shade of red. Also, does everyone else have the problem that in order for the hatch to come down, the pilot has to sit back and can't sit upright?
the compartment with the box for the mechanic's gear is prett cool.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: SMALL, SLEEK AND SUPER
review: I love this set. The rebel A-Wing is barely seen in the movie and is one of the under-rated vechiles, as it is only featured in ROTJ for a short while. I forgot to mension in another thread (snowspeeder) about who much I like the A-Wing as a small ship. It has the storage compartment, the cockpit and the A-Wing pilot along with a maitanence rebel. I love this set and I reakon it has no downsides. This set is also nicely worked for a under-featured set.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Fastest Fighter In the Rebel Armada
review:
This ship isnt very sleek, althgough is should be, it is hard for lego to design an ultra sleek model without using big molded pieces!  It has a nice array of heavy laser cannons on the side hardpoints and the minifig pilot is quit nice! You also get a rebel mechanic and tool box! The reddish color scheme is mighty nice and it uses some nice pieces and a cool back part! The A-wing isnt shown much but it is the hero in Ep6 when Lt.Jredda crashes headfirst into the Super Star Destroyer's bridge! This is an inspiring model that is hard to find nowadays!
A burning 10!

author: hustla187
title: Love the A-wing
review: This is an ultra-cool set to have in your Star Wars collection. I prefer this one over the new one because it came with a mechanic. The A-wing is very detailed from top to bottom. I like the cockpit and the little box for storage. This set is really awesome and should be owned by any Lego Star Wars fan.

author: smiley905
title: quite "blocky"
review:
this set is nothing to me compared to the new, sleek a-wing. this set is lumpy and doesnt look like it should, i know the tipe of blocks in 200 were limited but still, im not happy with it. now the good things about it are the storage compartment behind the guy, the engines are pretty cool and i realy like the guns, even though theyre incredably basic.

overall, i injoyed this set for a while but now its doomed to an eternity of spare parts

author: lego_here
title: great for being old
review:
This set is simply the best before lego star wars started making special pieces.I love this set so much ,its small,nimble and great for any type of collection.Its also the oldest set I have ,even though I dont have the box (because i got it off ebay) its still in my top 10 favorites .

pros
2 figures
cheap at the time
storage box that can go inside(and if you have a crane you can load it on with that!!)
clear cockpit
printed bricks
tools like a spanner and binocles

cons
yellow people though it wasnt until 2005 when they changed it to cream
bit blocky


If you find this set either on ebay,sale or in your attic make sure you get it as its great.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - A-wing Fighter
review:
The A-wing Fighter set (7134) is a LEGO Star Wars set which came out in 2000. It comes with 2 minifigs and 125 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7134-1.jpg[/img]

Minifigures:

A-wing pilot: The a-wing pilot comes with a green uniform with some cool markings on his torso. He has green pants and a black belt and black hands. He has a dark gray helmet ith some red and white markings. The pilot also comes with a transparent yellow visor. On his face you can see a headset.

Technician: The technician comes with a tan uniform, tan pants and a tan cap. He also has a black beard and he has a wrench in his hand.

A-wing Fighter:

The a-wing fighter is really fun to build. On the front you can see some slope pieces which have a small logo for the rebels. On each side you can see a turret which does sviwel. The cockpit opens easily and you can see the controls in the inside and the pilot fits in there very nicely. The trunk does open as well and you can see a container which you can put out. The container does open.

On the back you can see the engines and underneath the a-wing you can see some landing gears. The whole model is very sturdy. What is also interesting about the old instructions of the LEGO Star Wars theme is that you can find a few pictures of the movie.

Ideas:

These are some ideas which we get. There're no instructions for them in this set. You can find these ideas on the back of the box or of the instruction. I've done instructions for these ideas which I've uploaded on my website.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifigs
Nice army builder
No stickers
Ideas which you can find on the back of the box or of the instructions
Very sturdy

Negative:

I have anything to complain about that model.

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de
